title: When is bibliography used in research work? - Quora

response.answer_text: Always EXCEPT (1) in journalistic investigative articles intended for newspaper or mass-market magazine publication, in which case there are certain conventions to follow with regards to mentioning sources within the text, including noting sources that request anonymity and (2) in creative non-fiction essays (which can still have a bib if they like). In the case of academic work, bibliographies are ALWAYS necessary. Why? So your peers can check your sources to make sure you're not fibbing or plagiarizing. ;-)
